author: Abby Trivett
title: Vlad Savchuk: How to Defeat the Jezebel Spirit
text:
Share via:
Facebook
Twitter LinkedIn
Email
Print
Copy Link
Pastor Vlad Savchuk is sounding the alarm: the spirit of Jezebel is at work in today’s culture, and the church must rise up in boldness to confront it.
A Shift in Culture and the Church’s Response Savchuk explains that especially over the past decade, society’s perception of Christianity has drastically changed. He warns that what was once considered demonic has now been normalized—paganism, gender confusion and even open hostility toward biblical values. While the seeker-friendly model of church worked for a while, it cannot work now with a society raging against the truth of biblical values.
“We live in a generation today that is different than it was in the year 2000,” Savchuk says. “And if you use the same methods, you’re not going to be effective.”
This means that Christians today have no choice but to take a strong, biblical stance on issues. To truly be walking in the anointing and the power of God, this is necessary.
Breaking News . Spirit-Filled Stories . Subscribe to Charisma on YouTube now!
Anointing to Confront Jezebel Using the biblical account of Jehu in 2 Kings 9, Savchuk highlights how God raises up leaders to confront the spirit of Jezebel.
“I do believe in the midst of this craziness, in the midst of this wickedness, God is raising up a wild anointing,” Savchuk says. “It’s becoming more common, it’s becoming more acceptable and it’s actually going to become more trendy. Because for every Goliath God has a David. And for every Jezebel He has a Jehu.”
Get your FREE CHARISMA NEWSLETTERS today! Stay up to date with current issues, Holy Spirit news, Christian teachings, Charisma videos & more!
Hope for Revival Despite the increasing darkness, Savchuk has hope for the future. He prophesies a coming revival where church altars will be filled with repentant hearts.
“I believe a season is coming where the altars of the church are going to be filled with the lost people,” Savchuk says. “Any church that does not save the lost is lost…there is a shift in the realm of the Spirit.”
THANK YOU FOR VISITING MYCHARISMA.COM. TO ENJOY THE REST OF THIS MYCHARISMA POST, PLEASE VISIT THIS LINK.
Vlad Savchuk’s upcoming new book, “Make the Devil Homeless,” will be available in Fall of 2025.
Join Charisma Magazine Online to follow everything the Holy Spirit is doing around the world!
Abby Trivett is content development editor for Charisma Media .

author: Kelly Martin
title: Decarbonizing Web 3.0: A Green Future with AQGroup and MVGX - Investors Hangout
text: Decarbonizing Web 3.0: A Green Future with AQGroup and MVGX [Kelly Martin](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79570)Updated: 10-04-2024 12:54 AM Decarbonizing Web 3.0: A Green Future with AQGroup and MVGX In an innovative leap towards sustainable digital asset management, AQGroup is spearheading efforts to bolster Kazakhstan's position in the global digital economy through environmentally conscious digital mining. This initiative aligns with the values shared by MVGX Group, a pioneering digital green fintech based in Singapore, as they unite to promote a greener future. A Revolutionary Partnership in Sustainability AQGroup, noted for its leadership in green electricity production and computing infrastructure development, has entered into a strategic partnership with MVGX Group. This collaboration is both pivotal and timely, as it facilitates the exchange of knowledge and expertise between key players in the fintech and renewable energy sectors. Memorandum of Understanding Recently, the two entities formalized their partnership through a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), heralding a new era of collaborative effort focused on sustainable developments. This memorandum outlines plans to build an innovative hybrid green power plant. This plant will integrate wind, solar, and battery energy systems to ensure a consistent and sustainable energy supply for AQGroup's expanding data centers. Capitalizing on Kazakhstan’s Energy Potential Kazakhstan is positioned as a key player in the green energy landscape, boasting the world's ninth-largest land area along with abundant renewable energy resources. The country’s unique geographical position allows it to harness significant wind and solar energy potential, making it an attractive hub for investments in green energy generation. Government Support for Renewable Initiatives With government regulations designed to encourage the development of renewable energy, including a ten-year tax exemption for such projects, Kazakhstan provides a favorable regulatory environment for businesses focused on sustainable practices. This supportive backdrop, combined with Kazakhstan's strategic geographic location between Europe and Asia, enhances its role as a necessary collaborator in the global data center ecosystem. MVGX Group: A Financial Bridge to Sustainability MVGX Group, with its established presence in Singapore, plays a crucial role in bridging financial services with green energy initiatives originating from Kazakhstan. By utilizing Singapore’s advanced financial ecosystems, MVGX Group aims to facilitate the sale of green electricity produced through Kazakhstan's digital mining projects. Strengthening Global Financial Infrastructure Singapore's regulatory frameworks have successfully attracted numerous fintech companies, positioning the city as a financial hub in Southeast Asia. This partnership is set to capitalize on these strengths to create a formidable platform that supports sustainable digital asset mining while promoting robust carbon credit trading. Vision for a Sustainable Future By fusing the advantages of both Kazakhstan and Singapore, this partnership lays the groundwork for pivotal energy solutions and a financially integrated ecosystem supporting sustainable practices. In remarks about the partnership, AQGroup's Chairman, Islambek Salzhanov, expressed enthusiasm for the collective ambition to foster a greener future. Commitment to Collaborate and Innovate In his statement, Dr. Bo Bai, Co-Founder of MVGX Group, emphasized the importance of combining their respective expertise to support environmentally responsible practices. This collaboration not only aims to enhance the green digital mining landscape but also seeks to establish an innovative framework for carbon credit exchanges. Investment and Future Opportunities To ensure the success of their joint initiatives, AQGroup and MVGX Group are poised to launch a dedicated investment fund through Metaverse Green Exchange Pte. Ltd. The fund aims to attract significant investment for their green energy projects and promote the tokenization of real-world assets to ensure enhanced liquidity and transparency in green investments. Engaging with Various Stakeholders The two organizations are welcoming partnerships with a range of stakeholders, including green energy investors, manufacturing companies specializing in renewable energy technologies, and experienced EPC contractors. These collaborations are essential to establishing a robust ecosystem that supports both green energy production and digital asset mining. Frequently Asked Questions What is the focus of the partnership between AQGroup and MVGX Group? The partnership aims to enhance sustainable digital mining operations and develop green energy solutions in Kazakhstan. How does this partnership benefit Kazakhstan's energy sector? It leverages Kazakhstan's natural resources to produce renewable energy and enhances its role in the global sustainability agenda. What innovative solutions does MVGX bring to the partnership? MVGX offers expertise in financial technologies for sustainable practices, including carbon credit trading and investment strategies. How will this partnership impact global digital asset mining? The collaboration aims to promote environmentally sustainable mining practices, setting new standards for the industry. What opportunities for investment are associated with this partnership? They are establishing an investment fund to attract funding for green energy projects, promoting investor participation in sustainable initiatives. It draws in traders of all levels, who exchange market knowledge, investigate trading tactics, and keep an eye on industry developments in real time. Featuring financial articles, stock message boards, quotes, charts, company profiles, and live news updates. Through cooperative learning and a wealth of informational resources, it helps users from novices creating their first portfolios to experts honing their techniques. author: Buddy Iahn
title: Musicians can enhance videos with text-to-speech using CapCut
text:
In today’s fast-paced digital world, video content is crucial in communication, marketing, and entertainment. Whether you are a content creator, educator, marketer, or just someone who enjoys making videos, the ability to add high-quality voiceovers can significantly enhance your content. However, manually recording voiceovers can be time-consuming and require professional equipment to achieve a polished sound.
Enter CapCut Desktop Video Editor—a powerful yet user-friendly video editing tool that simplifies adding voiceovers with its built-in text-to-speech (TTS) feature. With this advanced tool, you can generate lifelike voiceovers from text in minutes, enhancing the quality and accessibility of your videos without the need for expensive recording equipment. In this article, we’ll explore how you can leverage CapCut’s text-to-speech feature to enhance your videos efficiently and effectively.
Why Use Text-to-Speech in Video Editing? Text-to-speech technology has advanced significantly, offering realistic and natural-sounding voices. Here are some key reasons why integrating TTS into your video editing process can be beneficial:
1. Time Efficiency Recording and editing voiceovers manually can take hours. With TTS, you can generate high-quality speech in seconds, allowing you to focus on other aspects of video production.
2. Cost-Effective Hiring professional voice actors or investing in high-end recording equipment can be expensive. CapCut’s built-in text-to- speech feature offers a budget-friendly alternative without compromising on quality.
3. Consistency and Clarity TTS ensures uniformity in tone, pronunciation, and volume across your video. This is especially useful for educational content, corporate presentations, and tutorial videos.
4. Multilingual Capabilities CapCut’s TTS feature supports multiple languages and accents, making it an excellent tool for global content creators who need to reach diverse audiences.
5. Accessibility Enhancement Adding a voiceover can make your content more accessible to individuals with visual impairments or those who prefer audio over text.
How to Use CapCut’s Text-to-Speech Feature CapCut’s desktop video editor is a good video editing software that offers a seamless workflow for incorporating TTS into your videos. Follow these simple steps to create high-quality voiceovers in minutes:
Step 1: Install and Open CapCut Desktop Editor If you haven’t already installed CapCut, visit the official website and download the desktop version. Once installed, open the application and start a new project.
Step 2: Import Your Video Clips You can import or upload the video footage you want to edit. Then, you can drag and drop your clips onto the timeline to arrange them as needed.
Step 3: Add Text for Speech Conversion Go to the “Text” tab and select “Add Text.” Type in the script you want to convert into speech. Ensure the text is clear, well-structured, and punctuated to achieve a natural-sounding voiceover.
Step 4: Convert Text to Speech Select the text box and click on the “Text-to-Speech” option. Choose from various voice styles, accents, and languages to match your video’s tone and audience preferences. You can add captions to your video using the CapCut Auto Captions feature.
Step 5: Adjust and Customize the Voiceover CapCut allows you to modify the speech speed, pitch, and tone to suit your content. Experiment with different settings to achieve the desired effect.
Step 6: Sync the Voiceover with Your Video Drag the generated speech onto the timeline and align it with your video clips. Trim or extend the voiceover as needed to ensure perfect synchronization.
Step 7: Add Background Music and Sound Effects To enhance your video further, consider adding background music or sound effects. CapCut provides a built-in library of royalty-free tracks to complement your voiceover.
Step 8: Export and Share Your Video Once satisfied with the final edits, click “Export” to save your video in the desired format and resolution. You can then share your video on social media, YouTube, or other platforms.
Best Practices for Using TTS in Videos To make the most out of CapCut’s text-to-speech feature, follow these best practices:
Keep the Script Natural and Conversational A robotic-sounding narration can disengage viewers. Write your script as if speaking to a friend—use contractions, natural pauses, and simple language.
Choose the Right Voice CapCut offers multiple voice options. Select a voice that matches the content—professional, friendly, energetic, or calming.
Adjust Pacing and Emphasis Modify the speed and pitch to make the narration sound more engaging. A slower pace works well for instructional videos, while a more dynamic tone is ideal for promotional content.
Proofread Before Converting Ensure there are no typos or grammatical errors in your script. Proper punctuation helps the TTS engine interpret natural pauses and inflections correctly.
Use Background Music Wisely Pairing your voiceover with subtle background music can enhance the viewing experience. However, make sure the mdoesn’tesn’t overpower the narration.
Who Can Benefit from CapCut’s TTS feature? CapCut’s text-to-speech functionality is versatile and can benefit a wide range of users:
Content Creators: YouTubers, TikTok influencers, and bloggers can quickly add voiceovers without recording manually.
Educators and Trainers: TTS makes creating instructional videos, online courses, and explainer content easy.
Businesses and Marketers: Companies can use TTS for product demos, promotional videos, and advertisements.
Podcasters and Storytellers: Those who prefer to script their content in advance can generate high-quality voiceovers for narration.
Social Media Managers: Quick and polished video content with professional voiceovers can boost engagement on platforms like Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.
Conclusion Final CapCut’s text-to-speech feature is a game-changer for video creators looking to enhance their content quickly and efficiently. This feature provides a seamless way to add professional voiceovers without the hassle of recording manually when making videos for personal use, educational purposes, or business promotions.
Following guide’side’s steps and best practices, you can create high-quality videos with engaging voiceovers in minutes. Try CapCut’s TTS feature today and elevate your video content effortlessly!

author: Rina Chandran
title: Australia's push to put more solar panels on rental homes | Context
text: Context is powered by the Thomson Reuters Foundation Newsroom. Our Standards: [Thomson Reuters Trust Principles](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/about-us/trust-principles.html) A social housing block where the government is funding the installation of a solar energy system to help residents manage high electricity bills in Adelaide, Australia. January 23 2024. Thomson Reuters Foundation/Rina Chandran About one-third of Australian homes have solar panels, but the benefits have eluded renters and those in social housing ADELAIDE – As a university student in Canberra, Eilis Fitt and her two housemates set rules to keep their electricity bill down - no heater in the living room unless everyone was home, and no turning on the washing machine or dishwasher during peak hours. So she was delighted - and surprised - when their landlord installed solar panels about a year after she moved in. After some initial hiccups, the effect was startling: their electricity bills "went down significantly," she said. "It made us feel so much more comfortable about turning on the heater when it got cold," said Fitt, 25. "We got lucky - it's very rare for renters to have solar. Landlords generally don't care about how much tenants have to fork out for their electricity use," she told Context. Australia has the highest solar capacity installed per capita in the world, with photovoltaic panels in about one-third of households, or 3.6 million homes. That helps many cope with some of the [highest electricity prices](https://www.globalpetrolprices.com/electricity_prices/) in the Asia Pacific. But the benefits have largely eluded renters and those living in social housing, with analysts estimating that only 4% of rental homes have solar power. "There are no incentives for renters to pay for solar systems themselves, since they have limited security of tenure, let alone rights to do much to the property itself," said Dylan McConnell, a renewable energy researcher at the University of New South Wales. "Similarly, landlords have limited incentive to install solar, since only the renter has the relationship with the energy retailer and can therefore benefit," said McConnell. But there is a growing realisation that installing solar on social housing and rentals - which make up more than 30% of properties - is essential to meeting clean energy targets, McConnell said. So there are efforts to encourage landlords to make that investment, he said, with incentives such as [grants, rebates and low-interest loans](https://www.solar.vic.gov.au/solar-rebates-rental-properties %20 ). Australia, with a population of some 25 million, is seeing more frequent extreme weather events such as forest fires, floods, and especially heat waves which are forecast to increase in frequency, intensity and duration due to climate change. Generous subsidies, alongside "dramatically escalating" electricity prices, kickstarted the household PV boom from around 2010, according to McConnell, helping more than double Australia's renewable electricity generation in the last decade. However, renters and those living in social housing are experiencing "energy hardship", the energy regulator said in a [November report](https://www.aer.gov.au/system/files/2023-11/Game%20Changer%20Report%20-%20November%202023.pdf) that recommended rebates and other assistance. A more desirable solution is solar, but it can be hard for renters and those living in low socio-economic areas to get finance, said Jenny Paradiso, co-founder and managing director of solar firm Suntrix. "The people who want solar have already got it by now. So we have to go after the renters, the low-income households, those who live far from the grid, and make it easier for them," she said in her office as Adelaide experienced its warmest day of the summer, with a high of more than 41 degrees Celsius (105.8F). Suntrix was among the first solar firms to install SolShare, a technology that allows apartments to share solar energy from a single rooftop system that is connected to the units via the building's main switchboard, and delivers energy equitably. "Tech plays a big part - it's not just about the panels," said Paradiso. "Technologies like SolShare make solar [more accessible](https://www.context.news/just-transition/indian-tech-could-boost-home-solar-panel-use-heres-how) to everyone." The SolShare, developed by Australian startup Allume, has been embraced by apartment blocks and affordable housing providers such as Housing Choices Australia, a non-profit that owns and manages about 7,400 properties across the country. Housing Choices has installed solar panels in more than a dozen properties each in South Australia and Western Australia, and in some 500 properties in Victoria, including three apartment blocks with SolShare, said spokesperson Emma Duncan. "Whilst a majority of the solar installations are initiated by Housing Choices, there has been a demand from residents for solar, especially in the past two years, with the rising cost of electricity bills," she said. Australia plans to increase the share of clean energy to as much as [82% of overall electricity supply](https://www.energy.gov.au/energy-data/australian-energy-statistics/renewables#:~:text=In%202022%2C%2032%25%20of%20Australia's,earlier%202021%2D22%20financial%20year.) by 2030 from about a third. Solar currently accounts for the biggest share of clean energy production, at nearly 14%. Solar is the "most cost-effective means to reduce greenhouse gas emissions related to household electricity use" because producing electricity at the point of consumption reduces transmission and distribution energy losses, according to the energy regulator. But with fewer subsidies and the declining value of energy exported back into the grid during daylight hours, there is less incentive for landlords to install solar, said McConnell. A survey last year by advocacy group Better Renting showed that about [one-in-three](https://assets.nationbuilder.com/betterrenting/pages/393/attachments/original/1697688496/Solar_Flair_report.pdf?1697688496) renters were keen to get solar because of non-financial reasons, such as contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable future. Yet most renters surveyed also worried that landlords would use solar to justify rent increases. At a social housing complex in Adelaide, where Suntrix is installing solar panels and SolShare as part of a government-funded renovation, residents in the 96 units are mostly concerned about lowering their electricity bills, said Paradiso. "There is greater awareness of the benefits of solar - though it's mostly the economic benefits they're looking at," she said. "But more and more, they are also worried about their carbon footprint." (Reporting by Rina Chandran; Editing by Jon Hemming) Context is powered by the Thomson Reuters Foundation Newsroom. Our Standards: [Thomson Reuters Trust Principles](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/about-us/trust-principles.html)

author: DPA
title: Tunneleinsturz in Los Angeles: 31 Arbeiter gerettet
text:
Die Sorge ist zunächst groß, als erste Meldungen über einen Tunneleinsturz in Kalifornien bekannt wurden. Doch eine Katastrophe ist ausgeblieben.
Aufatmen in Kalifornien: Nach dem Einsturz eines Tunnels im Großraum der US-Metropole Los Angeles hat die Feuerwehr alle Eingeschlossenen bergen können. 31 Menschen, wohl alle Tunnelarbeiter, seien am Mittwochabend (Ortszeit) lebend und ohne sichtbare Verletzungen gerettet worden, teilte die Feuerwehr mit. Der Unglücksort befindet etwa 30 Kilometer südlich des Zentrums von Los Angeles.
Ersten Berichten der Feuerwehr zufolge gelang es einigen Arbeitern nach dem Einsturz, über einen Berg loser Erde zu klettern. Auf der anderen Seite trafen sie demnach auf Kollegen. Anschließend seien die Eingeschlossenen mit einem Tunneltransportmittel zum Ausgang gebracht worden. Sanitäter versorgten daraufhin die Geretteten und untersuchten sie genauer, hieß es.
Ein großer Rettungseinsatz
Mehr als 100 Einsatzkräfte waren nach Angaben der Feuerwehr zum Unglücksort geeilt, darunter spezialisierte Rettungsteams. Der Einsturz passierte demnach mehr als acht Kilometer vom einzigen Tunneleingang entfernt. Es handele sich um einen im Bau befindlichen Tunnel für die kommunale Abwasserentsorgung, hieß es weiter. Die Ermittlungen zur Ursache des Einsturzes dauern an.
Etwa eine Stunde waren die Arbeiter in dem Tunnel eingeschlossen, meldete CBS News. Der Tunnel sei insgesamt mehr als 11 Kilometer lang und etwas mehr als fünf Meter breit, schrieb der US-Sender unter Berufung auf den Betreiber.

author: bahamaslocal.com
title: KALIK announces new sustainable packaging | Bahamas Local News
text:
Jamie Poitier, Warehouse Coordinator for
CBL (left) and Davon Smith, Packaging Operator for CBL (right) showcasing the new Kalik craft cartons NASSAU, BAHAMAS — Commonwealth Brewery Limited (CBL) has announced a milestone in its "Brew A Better World" sustainability project. KALIK, The Beer of The Bahamas, has begun transitioning its entire portfolio into eco-friendly craft cartons, replacing traditional corrugated cardboard.
The change marks a significant step towards reducing the brand's carbon footprint, leading to the most eco-friendly production process for this world-class Bahamian beer.
The new packaging, set to roll out over the next few months, will allow more of the brand's contents to be recyclable. Additionally, the low-cost material requires less water and energy for its production. Significantly, KALIK officials say this change will not affect the brand's brewing standards.
"KALIK is steadfast in our commitment to the cowbell, connection (inter-island), culture, and conservation," said Queswell Ferguson, Senior Portfolio Manager for Beers at CBL. "This eco-friendly design change is a bold step towards prioritizing sustainability and fulfilling our commitment to conservation. We want KALIKERS nationwide to take pride in choosing a brand that cares for both people and the planet, and in protecting our nation's beautiful natural environment."
Click here to read more on the Eye Witness News website
